comments:
This course introduces computer graphics techniques and can be taken immediately after CIS 120 (java programming). Scene graphs, computational geometry, graphics algorithms, and user interface design are used in 2D and 3D implementations. New programming languages include C++, OpenGL, FLTK, and Python. This course is programming-focused, with much of the grade dependent on homework assignments.

Students generally thought this course was “useful” and “important” due to the applicability of the material and the large amount of coding practice required. They especially valued the experience of completing extensive projects.

Students felt Professor Badler explained topics well, though his lectures were more theoretical than expected.

Students frequently commented that class assignments were poorly planned – though assignments were cumulative and built on their predecessors, the professor and TAs were often unable to return work in a timely manner. Many expressed difficulty in applying the theoretical information from lectures to homework assignments, and those without much experience with C++ found it extremely hard to follow the class.

This course is programming-focused, with much of the grade dependent on homework assignments.

Students generally thought this course was “useful” and “important” due to the applicability of the material and the large amount of coding practice required. They especially valued the experience of completing extensive projects.

Professor Albeck’s lectures were often described as “confusing” or not useful. Some students felt her explanations of C++ were “superficial” and did not help to guide their understanding from Java to C++.

Students frequently commented that class assignments were poorly planned – though assignments were cumulative and built on their predecessors, the professor and TAs were often unable to return work sufficiently before the next assignment. Many expressed difficulty in applying the theoretical information from lectures to homework assignments, and those without much experience with C++ found it extremely hard to follow the class.
